## WACC and Value Creation Threshold A firm has **Equity = \$227m**, **Debt = \$217m**, **Re = 13.7**%, **Rd = 8**%, **Tax = 30**%. Compute the **WACC** (after tax). ::: {.question-block}
✅ **Concept:** WACC is the **blended required return** from shareholders and debtholders, after the **interest tax shield**. Formula: WACC = (E/V)·Re + (D/V)·Rd·(1 − T). **Your numbers:** WACC = (227/444)×13.7% + (217/444)×8%×(1−30%) = **9.74%**.
::: Suppose a project in this firm has **expected return = 13.7%**. By how many **percentage points** does the project’s return **exceed the WACC**? (This gap signals **value creation** if positive.) ::: {.question-block}
✅ **Decision rule:** If **Project Return > WACC**, the project **creates value** (positive NPV under proportional scaling). **Your numbers:** Gap = 13.7% − 9.74% = **3.96 pp**. A positive gap indicates the project clears the firm’s opportunity cost of capital.
:::
